original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up at close, rupee at 321.20/50 against the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields closed higher on Friday and the rupee closed at 321.50/75 against the US dollar, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 closed at 28.75/29.25 percent, up from 28.50/90 percent from a day earlier.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 26.80/27.10 percent, up from 26.30/80 percent.
The rupee closed at 321.50/75 to the US dollar in the spot market. (Colombo/April21/2023)
